1. The highest power of a variable in a polynomial is the degree of the polynomial.
  2. A polynomial of degree \(2\,\) is called a quadratic polynomial and a polynomial of degree \(3\,\) is called a cubic polynomial.
  3. The coefficient of a term in the polynomial is the value preceding the term.
  4. If the value of a polynomial \(p(x)\,\) obtained on substituting the variable \(x\,\) with a real number \('a'\,\) is \(0\), then \('a'\,\) is a zero of the polynomial.
  5. Remainder Theorem : Let \(p(x)\,\) be any polynomial of degree greater than or equal to one and let a be any real number. If \(p(x)\,\) is divided by the linear polynomial \(x - a\), then the remainder is \(p(a)\).
  6. Factor Theorem : If \(p(x)\,\) is a polynomial of degree \(n > 1\,\) and \(a\,\) is any real number, then
    • \(x - a\,\) is a factor of \(p(x)\,\), if \(p(a) = 0\,\)
    • \(p(a) = 0\,\), if \(x - a\,\) is a factor of \(p(x)\).
  7. Factorization by splitting method : For a polynomial \(ax^2+bx+c\,\) find two numbers \(p\,\) and \(q\,\) such that \(p+q=b\,\) and \(p \times q = a \times c\,\).
  8. algebraic identities :
    • \((a+b)^2=a^2+2ab+b^2\)
    • \((a-b)^2=a^2-2ab+b^2\)
    • \((a^2-b^2)=(a+b)(a-b)\)
    • \((x+a)(x+b)=x^2+(a+b)x+ab\)
    • \((a+b+c)^2=a^2+b^2+c^2+2ab+2bc+2ca\)
    • \((a+b)^3=a^3+3ab(a+b)+b^3\)
    • \((a-b)^3=a^3-3ab(a-b)-b^3\)
    • \(x^3+y^3+z^3-3xyz=(x+y+z)(x^2+y^2+z^2-xy-yz-zx)\)
